question: Jill had a rectangular piece of paper. She cut her finger along the dotted line and made a L shape like this. Which of these statements is true? (A) The area of the L shape is greater than the area of the rectangle. (B) The area of the L shape is equal to the area of the rectangle. (C) The area of the L shape is less than the area of the rectangle. (D) You cannot work out which area is greater without measuring.

question: Mary is making a chart to show the number of houses on some streets. Every house symbol stands for 5 houses. There are 20 houses on Hill Stree. How many house symbols should Mary put in the chart beside Hill Street? (A) 4 (B) 5 (C) 15 (D) 20
